metadata.title: CVE-2017-5427 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
A non-existent chrome.manifest file will attempt to be loaded duringstartup from the primary installation directory. If a malicious user withlocal access puts chrome.manifest and other referenced files in thisdirectory, they will be loaded and activated during startup. This couldresult in malicious software being added without consent or modification ofreferenced installed files. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 52.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-5427` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 52.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 52.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 52.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 52.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '52.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
